page.title: 14ORIENTEERING AT BEDGEBURY
page.content: Orienteering, "The Thought Sport" or "Cunning Running", is of Scandinavian origin and has become popular in Britain with families as well as serious competitors at club, national and international levels. Participants navigate a prescribed course in (usually) wooded terrain using compass and map reading skills. The competitive aspect calls for fitness and the ability to select optimum routes, relating map to ground features while running at speed. Bedgebury Forest, ideal for orienteering, has been used often by local clubs, with special orienteering maps based on the Ordnance Survey but showing particular relevant details. Saxons Orienteering Club have mapped parts of the Forest (Frith Wood and Starvegoose Bank) and have held club, regional and championship events here.
